poem:
**The Diplomat Soldier**

In the ashes of politics,  
a citizen without a seat moves—  
not to the frontline,  
but to the backstage—all maps and papers,  
while katyushas hum their cold songs.  
Here, diplomacy sharpens its own edge,  
in service to a faraway flame,  
where signing a name  
becomes its own kind of courage.
